trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health FAQ

trans-unit.source: This FAQ answers questions about Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ answers questions about Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

trans-unit.source: This FAQ answers questions about Azure AD Connect Health.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ answers questions about Azure AD Connect Health.

trans-unit.source: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.

trans-unit.source: General Questions
trans-unit.target: General Questions

trans-unit.source: Q: I manage multiple Azure AD directories.
trans-unit.target: Q: I manage multiple Azure AD directories.

trans-unit.source: How do I switch to the one with Azure Active Directory Premium?
trans-unit.target: How do I switch to the one with Azure Active Directory Premium?

trans-unit.source: You can switch between different Azure AD directories by selecting the currently signed in User Name on the top right corner and choosing the appropriate account.
trans-unit.target: You can switch between different Azure AD directories by selecting the currently signed in User Name on the top right corner and choosing the appropriate account.

trans-unit.source: If the account is not listed here, select Sign out and then use the global admin credentials of the Directory that has Azure Active Directory Premium enabled to sign in.
trans-unit.target: If the account is not listed here, select Sign out and then use the global admin credentials of the Directory that has Azure Active Directory Premium enabled to sign in.

trans-unit.source: Installation Questions
trans-unit.target: Installation Questions

trans-unit.source: Q: What is the impact of installing the Azure AD Connect Health Agent on individual servers?
trans-unit.target: Q: What is the impact of installing the Azure AD Connect Health Agent on individual servers?

trans-unit.source: The impact of installing the Microsoft Identity Health Agent on the ADFS servers is minimal with respect to the CPU, Memory consumption network bandwidth and storage.
trans-unit.target: The impact of installing the Microsoft Identity Health Agent on the ADFS servers is minimal with respect to the CPU, Memory consumption network bandwidth and storage.

trans-unit.source: The numbers below are an approximation.
trans-unit.target: The numbers below are an approximation.

trans-unit.source: CPU consumption: ~1% increase
trans-unit.target: CPU consumption: ~1% increase

trans-unit.source: Memory consumption: Up to 10 % of the total system memory
trans-unit.target: Memory consumption: Up to 10 % of the total system memory

trans-unit.source: Network Bandwidth Usage: ~1 MB / 1000 ADFS requests
trans-unit.target: Network Bandwidth Usage: ~1 MB / 1000 ADFS requests

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]In the event of the agent being unable to communicate to Azure, the agent will store the data locally, up to a defined maximum limit.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]In the event of the agent being unable to communicate to Azure, the agent will store the data locally, up to a defined maximum limit.

trans-unit.source: Once the agent reaches the limit, if the agent has not been able to upload the data to the service, the new ADFS transactions will overwrite any “cached” transactions on a “least recently serviced” basis.
trans-unit.target: Once the agent reaches the limit, if the agent has not been able to upload the data to the service, the new ADFS transactions will overwrite any “cached” transactions on a “least recently serviced” basis.

trans-unit.source: Local buffer storage for AD Health Agent: ~20 MB
trans-unit.target: Local buffer storage for AD Health Agent: ~20 MB

trans-unit.source: Data Storage required for Audit Channel
trans-unit.target: Data Storage required for Audit Channel

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you provision a disk space of 1024 MB (1 GB) for the AD FS Audit Channel for AD Health Agents to process all the data.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you provision a disk space of 1024 MB (1 GB) for the AD FS Audit Channel for AD Health Agents to process all the data.

trans-unit.source: Q: Will I have to reboot my servers during the installation of the Azure AD Connect Health Agents?
trans-unit.target: Q: Will I have to reboot my servers during the installation of the Azure AD Connect Health Agents?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: The installation of the agents will not require you to reboot the server.
trans-unit.target: The installation of the agents will not require you to reboot the server.

trans-unit.source: However, installation of some of the prerequisite steps may require a reboot of the server.
trans-unit.target: However, installation of some of the prerequisite steps may require a reboot of the server.

trans-unit.source: For example, on Windows Server 2008 R2 the installation of .Net 4.5 Framework requires a server reboot.
trans-unit.target: For example, on Windows Server 2008 R2 the installation of .Net 4.5 Framework requires a server reboot.

trans-unit.source: Q: Does Azure AD Connect Health Services work through a pass-through http proxy?
trans-unit.target: Q: Does Azure AD Connect Health Services work through a pass-through http proxy?

trans-unit.source: Yes.
trans-unit.target: Yes.

trans-unit.source: For on going operations, you can configure the Health Agent to forward outbound http requests using an HTTP Proxy.
trans-unit.target: For on going operations, you can configure the Health Agent to forward outbound http requests using an HTTP Proxy.

trans-unit.source: See [Configure Azure AD Connect Health Agents to use HTTP Proxy](active-directory-aadconnect-health-agent-install-adfs.md#configure-azure-ad-connect-health-agent-to-use-http-proxy) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Configure Azure AD Connect Health Agents to use HTTP Proxy](active-directory-aadconnect-health-agent-install-adfs.md#configure-azure-ad-connect-health-agent-to-use-http-proxy) for more information.

trans-unit.source: If you need to configure a proxy during Agent registration, you need to modify your Internet Explorer Proxy settings.
trans-unit.target: If you need to configure a proxy during Agent registration, you need to modify your Internet Explorer Proxy settings.

trans-unit.source: Open Internet Explorer -> Settings -> Internet Options -> Connections -> LAN Settings.
trans-unit.target: Open Internet Explorer -> Settings -> Internet Options -> Connections -> LAN Settings.

trans-unit.source: Select Use a Proxy Server for you LAN.
trans-unit.target: Select Use a Proxy Server for you LAN.

trans-unit.source: Select Advanced IF you have different proxy ports for HTTP and HTTPS/Secure.
trans-unit.target: Select Advanced IF you have different proxy ports for HTTP and HTTPS/Secure.

trans-unit.source: Q: Does Azure AD Connect Health Services support basic authentication when connecting to Http Proxies?
trans-unit.target: Q: Does Azure AD Connect Health Services support basic authentication when connecting to Http Proxies?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: A mechanism for specifying arbitrary username/password for Basic Authentication is not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: A mechanism for specifying arbitrary username/password for Basic Authentication is not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Operations Questions
trans-unit.target: Operations Questions

trans-unit.source: Q: Do I need to enable auditing on my AD FS Application Proxy Servers or my Web Application Proxy Servers?
trans-unit.target: Q: Do I need to enable auditing on my AD FS Application Proxy Servers or my Web Application Proxy Servers?

trans-unit.source: No, auditing does not need to be enabled on AD FS Application Proxy Servers or Web Application Proxy Servers.
trans-unit.target: No, auditing does not need to be enabled on AD FS Application Proxy Servers or Web Application Proxy Servers.

trans-unit.source: It only needs to be enabled on the AD FS federated servers.
trans-unit.target: It only needs to be enabled on the AD FS federated servers.

trans-unit.source: Q: How do Azure AD Connect Health Alerts get resolved?
trans-unit.target: Q: How do Azure AD Connect Health Alerts get resolved?

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Alerts get resolved on a success condition.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Alerts get resolved on a success condition.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Health Agents detect and report the success conditions to the service on a periodic basis.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Health Agents detect and report the success conditions to the service on a periodic basis.

trans-unit.source: For a few alerts, the suppression is time based.
trans-unit.target: For a few alerts, the suppression is time based.

trans-unit.source: That is if the same error condition is not observed within 48 hours from alert generation, the alert is automatically resolved.
trans-unit.target: That is if the same error condition is not observed within 48 hours from alert generation, the alert is automatically resolved.

trans-unit.source: Q: What firewall ports do I need to open for the Azure AD Connect Health Agent to work?
trans-unit.target: Q: What firewall ports do I need to open for the Azure AD Connect Health Agent to work?

trans-unit.source: You will need to have TCP/UDP ports 80, 443 and 5671 open for the Azure AD Connect Health Agent to be able to communicate with the Azure AD Health service endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You will need to have TCP/UDP ports 80, 443 and 5671 open for the Azure AD Connect Health Agent to be able to communicate with the Azure AD Health service endpoints.
